item.description: A little bit of a clean-up on the blade, and a first attempt at the dreaded eye lenses. At the most, absolute maximum, only 80% cross-eyed?

It has been weeks since I did any actual painting. I’m really not sure this effect on the pointy bitâ€™s working, or even in keeping with the rest of the model, but it is ultimately more acrylic-on-plastic so I’m calling it a win!
Starting to add some secondary colours now that Tyrion-paralysis has ended.
Sketching in the light placement for Fancy Ladâ€™s eventual Fancy Backside. Very rough sketch. (Please only squint while viewing ðŸ˜…)
And heâ€™ll need those mittens, itâ€™s cold in space.

Head, shoulder, knee and toes (knee and toes). It may be a royal pain trying to colour-match freehand mistakes on a stippled shoulder gradient, but here we are. Itâ€™s all just a mix of the same two paints. How bad could it get ðŸ˜¬

Random midweek experiments: I wondered if I’d be able to get a smooth blend from quite dark to quite bright going brown-to-ivories, without resorting to an airbrush. I think the answer is definitely ’no’, at least with this approach. It gives its own effect though, the scratchiness of it could probably be read as weathering? I’ll have to give stippling a try.
I appear to be locked into an Accidental Grimdark with this one.
